rev.comment: /* Dispute over the name "anarchism" */ moved sylvan reference back up to top. don't put him in making it look like he's an anarcho-capitalist. he is not.

that term is not notable and hardly ever used

/* The nonaggression axiom */ market anarchism primarily used for mutualism; according to [[agorism]] it may be a subbranch of a-capitalism but not synonymous
npov - "free market anarchism" gets 706 hits on google
/* The nonaggression axiom */ reworded part on ind-an for accuracy

"An Anarchist FAQ" is the name, nor is it written "from a left perspective"
/* The nonaggression axiom */ source is good

/* "Left" and "Right" anarchism */ reword claims a bit; added a {{fact}} tag

/* Dispute over the name "anarchism" */ image deleted
/* Dispute over the name "anarchism" */ in caption stands it's an anarcho-capitalist point of view and picture gives visual representation of it
/* Dispute over the name "anarchism" */ the image is very POV and completely UNinformative
/* Practical questions */ if it's not a big deal, then don't put it up
/* Practical questions */ Look, I see no particular reason to remove the image except POV, and this is from an AC sympathizer. This is not a big deal.
/* Modern Somalia */ more accuracy on Somalia's lack of government
rev., the text is maybe sustainable but not the picture
/* Practical questions */ Come now, just because you disagree with it doesn't make it invalid. It's relevant because it's a common criticism.
/* Practical questions */ invalid argument, this has nothing to do with ancap
/* Practical questions */ neither does lysander spooner; this picture provides a visual for the caption
/* Practical questions */ picture has no connection with anarcho-capitalism
/* The nonaggression axiom */ better tag. source doesnt make the claim that is alleged it makes.
/* Practical questions */ move pic upward to better place
/* Practical questions */ why is the picutre being removed?
/* The nonaggression axiom */ disputed tag. "anarchist faq" is not arguing over whether the term being applied to anarcho-capitalists. try reading what they're talking about.
/* The nonaggression axiom */ disambig - not only them
/* The nonaggression axiom */ add source identifiers
/* The nonaggression axiom */ this is not what the FAQ argues. it's not disputing whether anarcho-capitalists are individualist anarchists. It's disputing that Tucker etc, are capitalists.
Raico is a biased source, too; shall we note that, as well? It would just look messy and ridiculous
/* The nonaggression axiom */ quoting from the author's of the faq. they say they "reject individualist anarchism" ..it needs to be known what their bias is. it's a bad source in the first place.
remove inaccuracy; this is getting silly
/* The nonaggression axiom */ noting faq written by anti-individualists

There is enough literature in which that has been the case, which RJII has linked; I can refer you to even further work that relates AC to IA in talk. See the work of Prof. Roderick Long (Aubern U).
Some anarcho-capitalists might call themselves individualist anarchists; but, more importantly, do IA call AC IA? Even more imp., do scholars call AC IA?
/* The nonaggression axiom */ There are enough anarcho-capitalists that refer to themselves as "individualist anarchists" that it is worth being here, but I agree the language should be more neutral.

Infinity, stop deleting sourced information. 4 sources are more than enough.
that's pov. there are plenty who believe the opposite
/* The nonaggression axiom */ put back in note that ancap is also individualist anarchism, with a few sources
/* The nonaggression axiom */ put back in note that it's also called individualist anarchism.
/* The nonaggression axiom */ This association is assumed; "individualist anarchism" is most certainly not a synonym for anarcho-capitalism
/* The nonaggression axiom */ individualist anarchism is not anarcho-capitalism
